question: A 55-year-old male presented to the clinic with the complaint of fever, weight loss, and back pain. On physical examination, extreme tenderness was noticed at the lumbar vertebrae. Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the lumbar spine showed evidence of Pott’s disease. Which of the following organisms is most commonly involved in this disease process?

A 45-year-old lady presented with sudden-onset of difficulty in micturition, and significant bilateral lower limb weakness. Examination reveals the power of 1/5 in both lower limbs, with saddle anesthesia. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Uric acid is the metabolic end product of which of the following compounds?
Which of the following autoimmune diseases is associated with the highest rate of malignancy?
Twisting of bone along its long axis leads to which kind of fracture?
How is a Colle's fracture managed?
What are the effects of radiation in the eye?

A 40-year-old woman presents to the clinic with shortness of breath, nausea, and difficulty walking upstairs. She has been taking medication for rheumatoid arthritis for the past 8 months. Which drug is most likely responsible for her complaints?
What of the following is referred to as a "Gamekeeper’s thumb"?
Which of the following is a non-nitrogenous bisphosphonate?
Which antibody is associated with interstitial lung disease in patients with polymyositis and dermatomyositis?

A 40-year-old female patient presents with back pain and extreme weight loss. She was diagnosed with breast cancer 5 years ago but she denied chemotherapy or any other form of treatment. What will be the next best investigation?

A 16-year-old child comes with his parents to the outpatient department. The parents complain to the doctor that their child has a short stature and has not developed puberty yet. The doctor examines the child and concludes that the bone age is less than the chronological age and diagnoses the child with constitutional growth delay. The parents are worried about the final height of the child. What would be the best treatment for this child?

answers.option: Surgery to increase the height of femur
No treatment and the final height is decreased.

question: What is the best management for open fractures?

A young gymnast comes to the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of lower back pain. The clinician after taking radiographs concluded that there is a defect in the pars interarticularis. What is this condition called?
A consultant confirms that there is a fracture of the pars interarticularis on the X-ray and is worried about it. What is the complication that this existing condition would lead to?

A 30-year-old male comes to the outpatient department with a complaint of acute onset shoulder pain. On examination, the external rotation is possible and there is a sub-acromial calcification seen on a plain radiograph. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following cases produces "light bulb" sign on X-ray anteroposterior view?
Which of the following vertebrae is involved in Jefferson's fracture?
A patient was prescribed hydralazine in order to control her hypertension. She later developed a malar rash, photosensitivity, and arthritis. What is the most likely diagnosis in this case?
Which of the following conditions is referred to as housemaid knee?
Which of the following gases is known to seep out from under houses and leak during construction/digging of earth, and potentially cause lung cancer?
A 9-year-old child is brought to the clinic with pain in the right leg associated with swelling. X-ray reveals evidence of Brodie's abscess. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A newborn is noticed to have the right upper limb missing from the forearm onward. Which term best describes this condition?

An intravenous drug user presents with the complaint of burning micturition and fever for 3 days. He also has gritty eyes and lower back pain for the past 3 months. He also has an ulcer on the glans of the penis. What is the most likely cause of these symptoms?
A child presents to the emergency department with a radius fracture. The surgeon wants to preserve the periosteum. What is the most likely reason for preserving the periosteum?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to the clinic with a complaint of dull hip pain for 3 years. On investigation, there is a mass of 10 cm × 13 cm attached to the hips which has irregular borders. Removal of the mass from ischium for biopsy reveals spotty calcifications. The transverse section of the mass reveals a blue-gray color. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which compound is responsible for the viscosity of synovial fluid?

A 42-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with complaints of progressive pain in different joints of the body, including small joints of the hands and knee joint for 2 months. She also has morning stiffness for about one hour every day. On examination, she has swelling of small joints of the hands and mild anemia. Which of the following investigations is most helpful in establishing a diagnosis?

A 17-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with complaints of low-grade fever, oral ulcers, and pain in small joints of her hands for 6 months. She is also having decreased urination with frothy urine. On examination, she has patchy hair loss, bilateral pedal edema, and swollen joints. Which of the following investigations has the highest prognostic value?

A 42-year-old male presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of low back pain for the past few years. He also has morning stiffness and pain which mostly stays for 2-3 hours. Currently, he has been experiencing pain in the back of his right ankle, however, there is no history of trauma. Which of the following is the most appropriate investigation to establish the diagnosis?
Which of the following radiographic findings is characteristic of rheumatoid arthritis?

A 67-year-old male, retired from his occupation, presents to the clinic with a complaint of non-radiating backache. He has lost 3 kg weight and his height is reduced by 3.5 cm. There is no comorbid, history of smoking or alcohol. DEXA scan shows a T score of -2.3 at the femoral neck. What is the best treatment plan for this patient?

answers.option: NSAID group of drugs, calcium and vitamin D supplement
Bisphosphonate, lifestyle modification and calcium supplement
Bisphosphonate, lifestyle modification, calcium and vitamin D supplements
Lifestyle modification, calcium and vitamin D supplements

question: A 5-week-old male infant is brought to the clinic with a complaint of inward rotation of feet since birth. What is the best treatment option for this patient?
On which of the following organs does the parathyroid hormone act directly to increase serum calcium levels?

A 10-year-old boy is brought to the clinic with a complaint of on-and-off pain in the knee joint for the last six months. On examination, his weight is at the 90th percentile, and there is a painful waddling gait with externally rotated feet. An x-ray of the hip joint is advised. What will be the expected radiological findings?

answers.option: Patchy vascularity of head of femur
Melting cone appearance at head of femur
Widening of interarticular space at the knee joint

question: Which of the following is the basis to confirm the diagnosis of gout?

answers.option: Increased uric acid excretion in urine

question: Which of the following enzymes is used to convert hypoxanthine to xanthine and xanthine to uric acid?

A 46-year-old man on dialysis due to chronic kidney disease presented to the physician for bilateral fractures of the tibia and fibula after falling in a washroom. He was treated with open reduction and internal fixation. His orthopedic surgeon ordered a dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DEXA), whose findings were consistent with the diagnosis of osteoporosis. Other investigations showed higher parathyroid hormone, low calcitriol, and low plasma calcium levels. Which of the following is the trigger for the aforementioned phenomenon?

A 2-year-old child presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of inability to walk. The child's weight is 8 kg. He was breastfed only for 15 days then switched to formula milk with inadequate dilation. Weaning was started after 9 months and his current caloric intake is 55% of the total requirement. He achieved neck holding at 4 months, sitting at 8 months and currently, he can stand with support only. His first tooth erupted at the age of 14 months. What biochemical abnormalities are most likely in this child?

answers.option: Normal serum calcium, decreased parathyroid hormone
Decreased serum calcium, increased alkaline phosphatase
Increased serum calcium, increased alkaline phosphatase
Increased serum calcium, increased parathyroid hormone
Decreased serum calcium, decreased alkaline phosphatase

question: For the evaluation of developmental dysplasia of the hip joint in a newborn, which of the following maneuvers is applied for assessment of dislocated hip joint?

A 2-year-old male child presents to the clinic with a complaint of short stature. On examination, he has a large head & tongue, corneal clouding, and coarse facial features. He is developmentally delayed. What is the most likely diagnosis?

An 11-year-old boy presents to the outpatient department with complaints of fever, pain, and swelling in joints. The symptoms have been present for 10 days. Four days ago, his right knee was painful and swollen but it was resolved, and later, his right ankle and left knee joint were also involved. Previous history is positive for sore throat 4 weeks back which responded to symptomatic treatment. On examination, he is febrile, respiratory rate is 32/min and heart rate is 160/min. His left knee and right ankle joint are swollen and extremely tender and warm. There is a restricted range of motion. The routine investigation is as follows: CBC normal, ESR 110, and antistreptolysin O titer (ASOT) are 1:800. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 21-year-old footballer comes to the clinic with a sudden onset, severe pain in his right groin after kicking a football. On examination, there is tenderness at the medial side of his thigh. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the serum marker for increased osteoblastic activity?
Which of the following structures is commonly associated with the term "strain," referring to an injury?
What is the primary cause of an avulsion fracture?

A 30-year-old tennis player leaves the match in between due to a sudden onset of severe pain in the medial side of the thigh. On examination, there is a contusion in the middle of the medial side of the thigh. What is the diagnosis?
A 25-year-old cricketer comes to the clinic with a complaint of pain in the back of the thigh. While bowling, he fell due to severe pain during the match. What is the most likely injured compartment?
Which structure's contraction is responsible for causing snapping hip syndrome?
What specific type of knee injury is the Lachman test primarily used for diagnoses?
Which of the following is not a long term complication of osteomyelitis?
Which of the following joints is most frequently and severely involved in rheumatoid arthritis?
Which of the following is not a feature of osteoarthritis?
Which bursa is affected in clergyman's knee?
Simmonds test is used for the diagnosis of which specific tendon rupture?

A 21-year-old male presents to the clinic with a complaint of pain in his right knee. X-ray indicates an avulsion fracture of the tibial tubercle. Which structure is most likely injured from the following?
Which tumor is common in the epiphysis region?
Which of the following factors makes aspirin different from other non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)?

answers.option: Increases the risk of colon cancer
Prevents episodes of gouty arthritis with long term use

question: A 28-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a history of falling on his outstretched hand in a road traffic accident. On examination, there is pain and tenderness in his right forearm, the distal nerve is intact. X-ray shows a distal radius fracture with dislocation of the ulna. What term is used to describe the fracture in this case?
Which of the following imaging modalities is most commonly used to assess joint damage in arthritis?
Which of the following is an analgesic and anti-pyretic drug that lacks an anti-inflammatory action?
Which of the following is the main advantage of ketorolac over aspirin?

answers.option: It does not prolong the bleeding time
It is less likely to cause acute renal failure in pre-existing renal impairment
It can be obtained as an over the counter medication
It can be given with opiods more safely such as codeine

question: An 18-month-old boy dies from an accidental overdose of acetaminophen. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's death?

A 55-year-old woman has been diagnosed as a case of acute gout and the physician is prescribing her a high dose of colchicine. The high dose of colchicine is more likely to cause which of the following side effects?
Which of the following is an IL-6 receptor antagonist that is also found to be effective in treating rheumatoid arthritis?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the rheumatology clinic with a six-month history of stiff hands and wrists. She mentions that the pain is particularly bad in the morning. On examination, the wrist, metacarpophalangeal joints, and proximal interphalangeal joints are swollen and warm. A diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis is suspected. The physician prescribes methotrexate along with a TNF-alpha inhibitor. Which of the following drugs belongs to TNF-alpha inhibitors?
Which of the following is a disease modifying antirheumatic drug whose active metabolite inhibits the enzyme dihydroorotate dehydrogenase?
Which of the following drugs is used for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis with special precautions to guard against the development of irreversible retinopathy?

A 59-year-old female is referred to the clinic for evaluation of osteopenia. Since menopause at 52 years of age, she has been on daily vitamin D supplementation. Her bone mineral density test reveals a T score of -1.6 at the lumbar spine, -2.2 at the left femoral neck, and -1.6 at the total left hip. Vitamin D acts through a nuclear receptor to produce which of the following effects in this patient?

answers.option: Increases the renal production of erythropoietin
Decreases the absorption of calcium from bone
Increases the absorption of calcium from the gastrointestinal tract

question: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) for the assessment of difficulty in walking. According to the patient’s mother, he started walking at 15 months of age but has been facing difficulty in climbing stairs for the last 6 months. On examination, muscle bulk in the legs is reduced bilaterally and calf muscles are hypertrophied. Tone, power, and reflexes are found to be normal but the boy has a waddling gait. Lab findings indicate markedly raised serum creatine kinase levels. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the best practical solution to remove temporary hardness of water at home?

A community in a small village in Northern Sindh seeks advice from a public health officer regarding the best source of water to avoid arsenic poisoning. Which one of the following sources of water must be advised against since it is most likely to be polluted with high levels of arsenic?
Which of the following is the most important component of a slow sand filter that is subjected to many purification processes?

A male patient of 60 years of age was diagnosed with a case of chronic gout. The treating physician prescribed him allopurinol for his treatment. Which of the following statements best describes the mechanism of action of allopurinol?
Which of the followings drugs is not included in disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDs) therapy?
Which of the following is the most common skeletal dysplasia?
“Brittle bone disease” is a name given to which of the following skeletal dysplasias?

An 18-month-old boy is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of inability to walk. He has a poor dietary history with a diet mainly comprising buffalo milk and solids. On examination, the child has a 10kg (22lb) weight, 80cm (2.6ft) height, and is found to be irritable. His anterior fontanelle is wide open and a prominent widening of the distal ends of his wrist is also seen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

An 11-year-old girl presents to the clinic with right knee pain for 10 months with no history of trauma. Pain is not limiting her activities. On examination, she is found to be obese. Her right knee appears normal with no tenderness on hip joints. A pelvis radiograph of both hips shows a widening of the proximal femoral epiphyseal growth plate. What is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

A 7-year-old boy presents with worsening pain in his leg for about four months. His right foot has started to turn inwards while walking resulting in a noticeable limp. A plain radiograph of the hip joint shows a flattened femoral head. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which one of the following statements is the most appropriate regarding the biological oxygen demand?

answers.option: It is the sum of polyvalent cations
It is the indicator of acidity
It is the indicator of dissolved oxygen
It shows growth and oxygen demand of bacteria
It shows the amount of oxygen available for life to survive in water

question: Which one of the following is the most cost-effective workable source of water for the Thar desert region that is least likely to be contaminated by pathogens along with being less likely to dry up during the prolonged summer season in the region?

A 44-year-old man visits a physician with complaints of chronic productive cough. He has also developed dyspnea on mild exertion lately. Chest X-ray shows small irregular opacities most prominent in the upper poles of the lungs. The man has a history of working in coal mines for 5 years. Which of the following is the most likely disease the physician should suspect?

The use of marble and stones gives an artistic look to the buildings. However, the workers of stone cutting, sandblasting, and ceramic industry are likely to be predisposed to which one of the following diseases?
People living in cities are continuously exposed to the adverse effects of noise. Which of the following is the most important source of noise pollution in urban areas?
An industrial worker has been exposed to noise pollution caused by industrial machines for the last 15 years. What is the most common auditory effect of long-term exposure to noise pollution?

A 20-year-old is sent for dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry to evaluate the bone mineral density of his lumbar spine, femoral neck, and total hip. The test results revealed significantly low bone mineral density in all sites. Which of the following drugs is routinely added to prevent osteomalacia?
A 40-year-old male is diagnosed with gout based on the synovial fluid analysis of his knee joint. Which of the following is an indication to start urate-lowering therapy?

answers.option: Evidence of bone or joint damage

question: The arc welding affects the eyes causing intense conjunctivitis and keratitis. Welder’s flash is caused by increased exposure to which of the following?
Which one of the following diseases is caused by exposure to ionizing radiations, x-rays, and radioactive isotopes?

A 50-year-old obese male presents to the clinic with complaints of pain and swelling in the first metatarsophalangeal joint of the left big toe for 2 days. He has a history of alcohol intake for 10 years. The given explanation best corresponds to which of the following?

answers.option: Presence of monosodium urate crystals in synovial fluid

question: A 10-year-old boy is brought to the clinic for assessment of short stature. He is the shortest in his class, good at studies, and also takes part in sports activities. On examination, the child is vitally stable, prepubertal having a height of 110 cm (3.6 ft), a weight of 27 kg (59.5 lb) with bone age of 10 years. His two elder siblings and father also have a short height. What is the most likely cause of his short stature?
A 28-year-old female is found to have deep vein thrombosis. She also has a history of two miscarriages. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 3-year-old boy is brought to the outpatient department (OPD) for growth assessment. On examination, he is vitally stable with a height of 85 cm (2.7 ft) and a weight of 12 kg (26 lbs). The child also has frontal and parietal bossing, bowed legs, and prominent costochondral junctions. His serum calcium is found to be 10 mg/dl, alkaline phosphatase is 520 IU/L and serum vitamin D is 4 ng/ml. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment choice?

answers.option: Calcium 500 mg once daily for 1 month

question: Which of the following features is not a characteristic of osteopetrosis?
Which of the following disease-modifying antirheumatic drugs provides the fastest symptom relief in rheumatoid arthritis?
Which of the following is the serum marker that indicates increased osteoclastic activity?
How many days are required for an uncalcified osteoid matrix to be mineralized?
Which of the following is the most common fracture in children?
Which of the following is a tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α) inhibitor used for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis?

A young boy sustains a fracture that traverses along the physis and towards its edge crosses through the metaphysis, resulting in the separation of a triangular piece of the metaphysis. What is the Salter-Harris classification for this fracture?

A patient with rheumatoid arthritis presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of radial deviation of the wrist and ulnar deviation of fingers with flexion and hyperextension of fingers. What is this deformity called?

A female patient presents to the outpatient department with complaints of dysphagia and muscle weakness most severe in the quadriceps and distal upper extremity muscles. Laboratory studies show elevated creatine kinase and the presence of antibodies to cN1A. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A middle-aged man presents to the clinic with cataracts, endocrinopathy, and cardiomyopathy. He also complains that he has sustained involuntary muscular contractions occasionally. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A child presents to the outpatient department with knock knees and deranged laboratory findings. His serum calcium is normal, serum phosphate is decreased, and urine phosphate and serum alkaline phosphatase are increased. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Which of the following Boolean operators can be used between the terms 'hypertension' and 'high blood pressure' to broaden the search?
Which of the following is a contraindication to the usage of celecoxib?
Which of the following is a feature of cleidocranial dysplasia?

A 29-year-old woman gave birth to a baby who was small for gestational age (<5th percentile). Some time later he is brought to the clinic due to growth abnormalities. On examination, the child has a normal torso and head size, short extremities, and bowing of long bones. However, there is no osteopenia. There is also no disturbance of activities in his daily life after necessary changes in the house and school. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 16-year-old boy is brought to the emergency room (ER) after an overdose of aspirin. What abnormalities are associated with an aspirin overdose?

A middle-aged woman presents to the outpatient department with complaints of fluctuating muscle weakness, diplopia, and drooping of upper eyelids. The muscle weakness worsens throughout the day. Electromyography shows decreased muscle activity after repeated stimulations. Which of the following conditions is associated with thymic abnormality?
A patient presents to the clinic with swelling of the 1st metatarsophalangeal joint. Which lab investigation will confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: Urate crystals in aspirated joint fluid

question: Welder’s flash predisposes the eyes to harmful diseases like cataracts due to ultraviolet radiation. What type of hazard is this?

A woman presented to the clinic with complaints of anorexia, constipation, increased thirst, and urinary frequency. Her serum calcium level was 12 mg/dl and her serum parathyroid hormone level was 135 pg/ml. What condition was she suffering from?
What is the name given to dead bone in osteomyelitis?

A 15-year-old girl from a low socioeconomic background presents to a primary healthcare facility with complaints of low-grade fever, back pain, and significant weight loss. Her sister had tuberculosis some time back. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 65-year-old woman, known case of diabetes and hypertension, has been diagnosed with a displaced sub-capital fracture of the femur. What is the most appropriate management option for her?

Two people, Mr. A and Mr. B, have retired. After retirement, Mr. A continues to engage in charity work, reads up, and remains social. Mr. B, on the other hand, stays at home with limited social interaction. How will this lifestyle benefit Mr. A?

answers.option: He will have more social networking
He will live a happy life
He will have a lesser tendency to develop neuropsychological disturbances

question: A 20-year-old boy presents to the orthopedic clinic with back pain. On examination, he has fixed deformity of the cervical, dorsal, and lumbar spine. X-ray shows sclerosis of the iliosacral joint. His ESR and CRP are normal. Rheumatoid factor is found to be negative while HLA-B27 is positive. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following drugs is used during an acute attack of gout but is neither an anti-inflammatory, an analgesic, nor a uricosuric drug?
Which of the following is the drug of choice in acute gout?
In Northern areas of Pakistan, people die in their sleep due to inhalation of an indoor poisonous gas produced by a heater. Which gas is responsible for this?
Which of the following structures is responsible for regulating proximal limb outgrowth by secreting fibroblast growth factors to induce the limb mesenchyme during embryogenesis?

A child had hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, and thick, sclerotic bones with flat, deformed metaphyses. He was diagnosed with osteopetrosis. The function of which of the following cells is impaired in osteopetrosis?
A child has hepatosplenomegaly, anemia, multiple fractures, and cranial nerve deficits. Radiography reveals thick, sclerotic bones with flat, deformed metaphyses. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 23-year-old boy has increasing eye pain and decreased vision, which worsens upon sunlight exposure. History reveals the presence of low back pain for the past 3 years. Which of the following systemic diseases must be looked for in this patient?

A 25-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of arthritis and morning stiffness of multiple small joints of the hands. He also reports a history of intermittent attacks of diarrhea for 6 months. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is a natural cause of pollution?
A middle-aged man presents to the clinic with joint pain, urethritis, and conjunctivitis. He has also developed a calcaneal spur. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the branch of medicine that deals with the study of the harmful effects of chemical and physical agents called?
Parathyroid hormone has a role in the synthesis of active vitamin D3. Which of the following enzymes is activated by the parathyroid hormone?
What is the most appropriate management for a femoral shaft fracture in a 1-year-old child?
Where is osteosarcoma most commonly found?
An athlete is training for the Olympics with his trainer. What must the trainer keep in mind at all times to ensure optimal health of the athlete?

A 45-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with a history of 2 episodes of acute gout in the past 7 months. She currently has hyperuricemia for which chronic gout therapy needs to be started. Which of the following drugs would decrease uric acid production?
What is the most appropriate management for fractures of the diaphysis of femur?
What is the most appropriate surgical management for severe knee osteoarthritis in an elderly patient?
A surgeon finds a mass in the diaphysis of a young child. Which radiological feature will favor the diagnosis of a malignant tumor over a benign one?

A 71-year-old man has experienced aching pain in the right knee, lower back, right distal fifth finger, and neck over the past 10 years. He notices that the joints feel slightly stiff in the morning, but this passes quickly. The pain is worse toward the end of the day. On physical examination, there is no joint swelling, warmth, or deformity. Some joint crepitus is audible on moving the knee. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 13-year-old boy who was previously healthy has had pain in his right leg for the past month. There is no history of trauma or recent illness. A radiograph of the right leg shows a 6-cm expansile mass in the diaphyseal region of the right lower femur that extends into the soft tissue and is covered by layers of reactive bone. A biopsy of the mass is done, and microscopic examination shows sheets of closely packed, primitive cells with small, uniform nuclei and only scant cytoplasm. Karyotypic analysis of the tumor cells shows a t(11:22) translocation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A lady presents to the outpatient department with pain in multiple joints and a rash over her eyelids and periorbital area. Anti-Mi2 antibody is found to be positive. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 9-year-old boy has leg pain and difficulty in walking. There is no history of fever or trauma. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following is the main mechanism for the anti-inflammatory action of aspirin?
What is the mechanism of action of aspirin in causing bronchospasm?

answers.option: Drug-mediated hypersensitivity on H1 receptors in bronchial smooth muscles
Drug-mediated hypersensitivity on M receptors in bronchial smooth muscle
Drug-mediated hypersensitivity on H2 receptors in bronchial smooth muscle

question: Which of the following statements is true about the action of aspirin?

In the absence of parathyroid hormone receptor binding on osteoclasts, which factor produced by osteoblasts binds to osteoclast precursor cells and promotes their differentiation into mature osteoclasts?
Steroids can lead to which of the following?

A middle-aged man presents to the outpatient department with complaints of burning micturition and joint pain. Culture shows the presence of gram-negative diplococci. What is the most likely causative organism?
A woman presents to the clinic with pain and tenderness in the lower back and a rash over the extensor surfaces of the body. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following organisms is most commonly responsible for causing osteomyelitis?
Which of the following statements about Colles' fracture is true?

answers.option: Management is closed manipulation and casting
It most commonly occurs in children
